com.ut.mpc.utils

Class STRegion

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ut.mpc.utils.STRegion

  • public class STRegion
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a range object commonly used for queries The range can be conceptualized as 2 STPoints, one for minimums and one for maximums. In 3 dimensions, the range can be visualized as a cube with the mins point in one of the upper corners and the maxs point in one of the lower corners

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      STRegion() 
      STRegion(STPoint p1, STPoint p2) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPoint(STPoint point)
      Adds a point to the range, if the point does not contribute to the range's minimum or maximum values, it will not affect the range
      STPoint getMaxs()
      Retrieves the range's maximum values
      STPoint getMins()
      Retrieves the range's minimum values
      java.lang.String toString()

        public void addPoint(STPoint point)
        Adds a point to the range, if the point does not contribute to the range's minimum or maximum values, it will not affect the range

      • getMins

        public STPoint getMins()
        Retrieves the range's minimum values
        Returns:
